WRITING.TEXT: I played through Super Metroid and listened to Live's Throwing Copper when they were still fresh. To this day I still hear "I Alone" in my head whenever I think of Metroid. Recently I was playing Guacamelee, and when I realized it was a Metroidvania style game, I went right back to the 90s in my head.
I've seen this gif too many times, and it's never been funny. But I never noticed that guy's reactions until now. Ideal alchemy in action.

Last year I was pushing people to read this. And Octavia Butler's Parable of the Talents. Too late to prevent Trump from being Prez, but if you want to know how it turns out, these are the books that will enlighten you.

Me too. I was diagnosed with ADD as a teen. Ritalin helped at first (with everything in my life), but eventually I couldn't read anymore. I just didn't give a crap about what I was reading. For many reasons, I took myself off the Ritalin--I just applied the organizational skills I'd learned while medicated to make life doable. A wonderful side effect of getting off the mess was a renewed passion in many things, including reading. It's still hard sometimes and I find I've read several pages without absorbing anything, but I enjoy it enough that I soldier through those attention deficit spells.
I could never be a teacher because I'd be cracking up at that point. I'd know I should serious and mad, but I'd just be doubled over with laughter.
The whole Tiny Desk series is amazing. Some highlights for me include Noah and the Whale, Edward Sharpe, and Josh Ritter, to name a few.
I thought it looked off. Still an enjoyable performance. I checked out some of her other stuff and was not nearly as drawn in as I was by this version.

WRITING.TITLE: #8220;That #8217;s the same code as my luggage! #8221;

WRITING.TEXT: For me, cold turkey (plus chewing gum) was the only way to go. #8220;Slowing down #8221; never helped. My parents both went with Nicorette, and still chew it to this day, years after quitting. Still better than smoking! Twice in my life since quitting, I took up occasional social smoking, and both times, it started getting out of hand, so I #8217;m done with that idiocy now. Good luck, and keep trying. A relapse isn #8217;t an excuse to keep smoking for another month or year, it #8217;s an opportunity to try again right now.
It #8217;s all I saw before I read your title, so you #8217;re right on.
Your [competition](http://www.polycade.com) charges a hefty $3900 for a stock unit, so you #8217;ve got some room if you #8217;re customizing it.
The Polycade is gorgeous but expensive. If you #8217;re really up for custom orders, I think you could have a side gig. Beautiful work whether you commercialize or not.
I don #8217;t know about all of this negativity. This is just plain dumb fun. That #8217;s ok sometimes!

I just replaced a Craftsman chain drive with a Chamberlain belt drive. I replaced the opener button, the drive and the belt rail, but kept everything else (including the old sensors). Worked fine for me.

Parallel path for me. My breakfast date (where I was sadly and terribly hungover) turned into lunch, hike, dinner and ice cream before finally ending. I proposed a year later where we hiked and this Christmas my wife is buying me and my kindergartener the hulk buster LEGO set for Christmas. The green light was that neither of us wanted the date that lasted 8 hours too long to end. PS - I later learned she #8217;s not a big hiker, but she did it (and does it) for me. Easy selflessness from both parties is a green light.
You can ride all the way to Valley Forge fairly easily along that trail. It gets weird in Manayunk. A shorter but still great ride is up to the East Falls Bridge and back on MLK.
I have a kid who is too young to see the R rated Deadpool but has begged me to watch it anyway. This PG-13 version could be perfect for all us nerdy parents.

Yes, narrators are an important part of the experience. Another comment on narrators is listening to the same narrator across different books. Scott Brick is a narrator I like quite a bit, but I listened to the Bourne trilogy which were long books and narrated by him. Later I tried to listen to something completely different narrated by him and all I could imagine was the next action sequence with Bourne in it. For me, the denser the book, the better suited to actual reading. Fluffier books tend to be good choices for Audio.
Probably not. But she would notice if you disappeared into the basement for 20-30 hours.
My question too.
They have a major resort in Orlando that uses the same colors and similar fonts for all signage, so Disney was a reasonable guess.

I pre ordered the standard edition, and every time I try to open Sniper Assassin, it redirects me to the gold edition in the PSN Store. Very frustrating and hard to figure out what is going on here. It #8217;s time to do away with different versions of games. Just up the price to $65 if you need the extra money. Video games haven #8217;t increased in price substantially since N64 (when they were sometimes more than $60!)

WRITING.TITLE: Dremel 3D20 Love
WRITING.TEXT: I just got my first printer, and it #8217;s the entry level Dremel. I think it #8217;s great and I wanted to spread some love. Every site I go to, it seems that people are drooling over the Ender 3, and I #8217;m sure it #8217;s great. BUT, the lil #8217; Dremel hardly gets mentioned. Kudos to Dremel for embracing this movement, and trying to bring it to the mainstream. Anyone can pick one of these up (at Home Depot, even) and print a part within 30 minutes of getting home. If you #8217;re new to this space, or want to get into it, but find yourself intimidated by all the message boards full of smart people with nerdy (meant in the best way) opinions, maybe the Dremel is right for you.

That #8217;s a fair point. Going price on Amazon is $600, but Home Depot is inexplicably $800. At $600 it feels like a good deal for something that #8217;s being marketed as a consumer good instead of something only for hobbyists. $199 for Ender 3 is a hell of a deal.

OP, does the pan stink like scallops still? I made some amazing scallops on a friend #8217;s cast iron skillet once. Everybody loved me until they realized the smell wouldn #8217;t go away. To this day, I #8217;m reminded about how I ruined my friend #8217;s pan.
I didn #8217;t clean the pan, but I bet boiling water was not a step. I #8217;ll try that next time.
Yeah, the smart key is a pretty handy system.

I read this because I thought Metallica was cool and I'd be cool if I read a book they wrote a song about. But wow did it mess me up. Short as hell which worked really well, it was like a quick kidney punch where the after the shock wears off, there's a dull lingering pain for the long haul.
I just wanted it to end.

You have to admit, #8220;Gunship #8221; is a legit name for that game. But yes, I #8220;turned on the brain #8221; for a minute and realized #8220;Gunship #8221; is the band. Ignorance aside, I learned about a cool new band today (which is really the best type of exit from ignorance there is)!
I second that. Though, personally, the band fills a hole I didn #8217;t even know I had.

gt;You want an angled sash brush. Spend $15 on a brush, and wash it when you're done until there's no paint. It'll last you 5+ years as a DIY painter, it'll hold paint better, it will physically paint better, and you'll be much happier 100% this. I don't usually spring for brand name when it comes to things with a limited life, but a nice brush (I like Purdy, but I'm sure Wooster and similar are good, too). Getting away from taping saves time, and makes cleaner (if not always straighter) lines.

WRITING.TITLE: A brave champion has arisen to slay the stink bugs

WRITING.TEXT: I watched for about 5 minutes with no movement. Went back 30 minutes later, and he was chomping on the stink bug. I #8217;ll update the post with the final result.
Took a while, but she finally got the stinker. I didn't get to see the attack, but I did see her [chowing down](https://imgur.com/a/mqJSnb4).
Yeah, all of Reddit needed to see that! Maybe [this](https://imgur.com/a/HXhTfMJ) is better.
I think she just bit the head off and kept gnawing away. It does look like a pita pocket though.
